keywords: eat: the little book of fast food
name: Marmalade Chicken From 'Eat: The Little Book of Fast Food'
description: This is as simple as it gets, and it's perfect for a busy night. For this recipe from his newest cookbook, Eat, Nigel Slater combines marmalade and whole-grain mustard, pours the mixture over chicken legs, and bakes them. Then he...Nope, that's it, and they're terrific.

recipeInstructions.text: Put 6 large chicken drumsticks on a foil-lined baking sheet or in a small roasting pan. Mix 6 heaping tablespoons of marmalade with 3 tablespoons of whole-grain mustard and a grinding of black pepper. Spoon the seasoned marmalade over the chicken and bake for about 30 minutes in an oven set at 400°F (200°C), keeping an eye on them so they don't burn.
